intro: Mimusops dispar, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and elongated, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible, orange-colored berries. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
